a24d9925-55c8-41d5-9a28-a33119218631.summary: Does ignorance of truth preclude knowledge?
a24d9925-55c8-41d5-9a28-a33119218631.content: {A person can accidentally hold a true belief without understanding why it is true.}, {Intuitively, beliefs held without understanding do not qualify as knowledge.}

62b1a91a-5f3b-46c9-b3c7-982c198efdb2.summary: Can knowledge be derived from beliefs without cognitive justification?
62b1a91a-5f3b-46c9-b3c7-982c198efdb2.content: {A belief is held simply because it conforms to previous unrelated beliefs rather than accurate perception.}, {Intuitively, such beliefs do not count as knowledge without justification.}

e3acca2b-fb37-44ba-a6d4-6180f60df2b3.summary: Can mistaken beliefs derived from accurate perception still be considered knowledge?
e3acca2b-fb37-44ba-a6d4-6180f60df2b3.content: {An accurate perception leads to a mistaken conclusion due to misleading circumstances.}, {Intuitively, conclusions that diverge from truth do not constitute knowledge.}

450f3b25-1183-4868-86cd-ce8cd149e7e2.summary: Do different kinds of perception equally lead to knowledge?
450f3b25-1183-4868-86cd-ce8cd149e7e2.content: {Visual illusions can lead to perceptions that seem accurate but are misleading.}, {Intuitively, such illusions divert from true knowledge despite accurate perception.}

bc67d6fb-028a-4db5-8a0c-85aa960073a6.summary: Can knowledge come from perception without external verification?
bc67d6fb-028a-4db5-8a0c-85aa960073a6.content: {A perception occurs that coincidentally aligns with reality without external confirmation.}, {Intuitively, validation is required to consider this perception as providing knowledge.}

9e8ca5a1-e7a9-48bb-a294-1a5ae4c16d0c.summary: Is perceptual knowledge independent of belief revision?
9e8ca5a1-e7a9-48bb-a294-1a5ae4c16d0c.content: {A person holds a true belief based on perception but never updates it when confronted with new, relevant information.}, {Intuitively, failure to revise beliefs undermines the claim to knowledge.}

2883fccd-2be8-4452-8353-bc4dba166994.summary: Do personal biases compromise perception-derived knowledge?
2883fccd-2be8-4452-8353-bc4dba166994.content: {An accurate perception is interpreted through a lens of strongly held biases.}, {Intuitively, knowledge claims are compromised by biased interpretations.}

d75a7aca-8cda-40c4-8458-ef963e321a96.summary: Can implicit knowledge arise from unknowable perceptions?
d75a7aca-8cda-40c4-8458-ef963e321a96.content: {Certain perceptions cannot be consciously accessed by an individual to form explicit beliefs.}, {Intuitively, only explicit beliefs derived from perception qualify as knowledge.}

3f64a64f-93a7-48b1-bb2a-79d3d4b0e99f.summary: Does temporal mismatch between perception and reality affect knowledge?
3f64a64f-93a7-48b1-bb2a-79d3d4b0e99f.content: {Perception happens after the reality it represents has changed.}, {Intuitively, outdated perceptions do not provide current knowledge.}

bb225408-2e2f-49ad-bc0a-80505fe87431.summary: Is knowledge affected by sensory limitations?
bb225408-2e2f-49ad-bc0a-80505fe87431.content: {A perception is formed with limited sensory input, not fully reflecting the reality.}, {Intuitively, incomplete perceptions do not provide thorough knowledge.}

ddc62e9f-e99b-4bfc-9f73-9887ad99b9e7.summary: Does contradictory perception affect knowledge derivation?
ddc62e9f-e99b-4bfc-9f73-9887ad99b9e7.content: {Contradictory perceptions arise simultaneously in different contexts, both seeming accurate.}, {Intuitively, contradictions undermine claims to knowledge.}

877ff4e7-26c8-4825-825c-fb952898cc7b.summary: Can the emotional state influence perception-derived knowledge?
877ff4e7-26c8-4825-825c-fb952898cc7b.content: {Emotional responses alter perception, affecting its accuracy.}, {Intuitively, emotionally altered perceptions do not fully represent reality for knowledge claims.}

2c76a72c-000a-4bc7-b17f-40ed2a2761f4.content: {Perception is shaped by prior expectations, aligning with them rather than the objective reality.}, {Intuitively, expectation-influenced perceptions are not reliable sources of knowledge.}

da3c2202-2094-4de5-87f3-90b391d60d05.summary: Reliabilism: Knowledge as Reliably Produced True Belief
da3c2202-2094-4de5-87f3-90b391d60d05.content: {A person knows a proposition if the proposition is true}, {A person knows a proposition if they believe the proposition}, {A person knows a proposition if the belief in the proposition is produced by a reliable cognitive process}

4f953567-9764-4df5-a8ce-d730958f4751.summary: No-False-Lemmas Theory: No Knowledge from False Reasoning
4f953567-9764-4df5-a8ce-d730958f4751.content: {A person knows a proposition if the proposition is true}, {A person knows a proposition if they believe the proposition}, {A person knows a proposition if the person is justified in believing the proposition}, {A person knows a proposition if the justification for the belief does not include any false premises}

9d160f3c-61a6-49a0-8f6f-bfe9467de0f5.summary: Causal Theory of Knowledge: Causal Connection Requirement
9d160f3c-61a6-49a0-8f6f-bfe9467de0f5.content: {A person knows a proposition if the proposition is true}, {A person knows a proposition if they believe the proposition}, {A person knows a proposition if there is an appropriate causal connection between the fact that makes the proposition true and the person's belief in the proposition}

cfe54abf-d1ea-48cd-8406-c9935c81ac3d.summary: Safety Theory of Knowledge: Belief Necessarily Corresponds to Truth
cfe54abf-d1ea-48cd-8406-c9935c81ac3d.content: {A person knows a proposition if the proposition is true}, {A person knows a proposition if they believe the proposition}, {A person knows a proposition if the belief could not easily have been false, given the method of forming the belief}

e6093b5e-d9d6-428a-90b6-243af43504ef.summary: Virtue Epistemology: Knowledge as Achievement Accruing from Epistemic Virtue
e6093b5e-d9d6-428a-90b6-243af43504ef.content: {A person knows a proposition if the proposition is true}, {A person knows a proposition if they believe the proposition}, {A person knows a proposition if the belief is the result of an intellectual virtue, which is a stable and reliable disposition to form true beliefs}

8c79ca25-710a-4b97-bf59-5963831aa944.summary: Proper Functionalism: Knowledge Through Properly Functioning Cognitive Faculties
8c79ca25-710a-4b97-bf59-5963831aa944.content: {A person knows a proposition if the proposition is true}, {A person knows a proposition if they believe the proposition}, {A person knows a proposition if their cognitive faculties are functioning properly according to a design plan aimed at truth}

27da5643-cef5-4f27-9faf-df242a788e3b.summary: Contextualism: Knowledge Depends on Contextual Standards
27da5643-cef5-4f27-9faf-df242a788e3b.content: {A person knows a proposition if the proposition is true}, {A person knows a proposition if they believe the proposition}, {A person knows a proposition if the person meets the epistemic standards which vary according to different contexts}

14873cdc-2026-4a2c-a9ea-6eff4c8783af.summary: Sensitivity Theory: Belief Varies with Truth Across Possible Worlds
14873cdc-2026-4a2c-a9ea-6eff4c8783af.content: {A person knows a proposition if the proposition is true}, {A person knows a proposition if they believe the proposition}, {A person knows a proposition if, were the proposition false, the person would not believe the proposition in nearby possible worlds}

80ca1126-7346-4838-99aa-1619d71cc573.content: {A person knows a proposition if the proposition is true}, {a person knows a proposition if the person reliably forms a true belief about the proposition}, {a person knows a proposition if the belief is produced by a reliable cognitive process}

7837e8fe-c9f2-44bd-b4e2-8880617c0756.content: {A person knows a proposition if the proposition is true}, {a person knows a proposition if the person believes the proposition}, {a person knows a proposition if the person has justification for believing the proposition}, {the person's justification must not include any false beliefs}

47b3d0cc-d83d-4124-8fa7-d00faad4db07.content: {A person knows a proposition if the proposition is true}, {a person knows a proposition if the person's belief is caused by the fact that makes the proposition true}, {the causal connection between the proposition and the person's belief is necessary for knowledge}

d7e6ee1b-b0be-4563-86b5-7712721c0747.content: {A person knows a proposition if the proposition is true}, {a person knows a proposition if the person believes the proposition}, {if the proposition were not true, the person would not believe the proposition}, {if the proposition were true, the person would believe the proposition}
